metadata.title: CVE-2016-0718 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Expat allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed input document, which triggers a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-0718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
libexpat1 - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

firefox - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

notes.note: ebarretto> tla uses system expat as of 1.3.5+dfsg-15

criterions.comment: cadaver package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
coin3 package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
expat package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1ubuntu1').
firefox package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '48.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
libxmltok package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
swish-e package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
tla package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
xmlrpc-c package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
